channel.title: Latest World News Headlines | Daily Telegraph

item.title: Cancer, heart disease jabs by end of decade

description.#cdata-section: The pharmaceutical firm behind a major Covid jab has claimed it has the ability to manufacture vaccines for cancer, heart conditions and auto-immune diseases by the end of the decade.

item.title: Police: Girl, 12, badly hurt in Cobbs Creek shooting

description.#cdata-section: Police say a 12-year-old girl was shot in the backside Friday night in Philadelphia's Cobbs Creek section.

item.title: Walk for Hope returns to Detroit with urgent call to end gun violence

description.#cdata-section: Demonstrators took to the streets in Detroit on Friday evening as they called for an end to gun violence during the Walk for Hope.

item.title: Canada’s infant mortality rate on the rise

description.#cdata-section: Canada’s infant mortality rate is on the rise. The country has fallen from the top 10 of developed nations to near the bottom of the ranking — a clear sign that health care and support for new mothers is slipping.

item.title: Quebec major junior hockey league bans fighting

description.#cdata-section: The Quebec Major Junior Hockey League has voted to ban fighting, with players facing automatic expulsion starting next season. The aim is to protect the health of vulnerable young adults.

item.title: Ice storm death toll rises amid widespread power outages

description.#cdata-section: A third person has died in connection with a powerful ice storm that hit Quebec and Ontario. This comes as hundreds of thousands of customers remain without power.

item.title: Family celebrates first Easter holiday in Canada after escaping war

description.#cdata-section: A family is celebrating their first Easter holiday in Canada after escaping the war in Ukraine. They say their prayers for safety, after spending years trapped between wars, have been answered.

item.title: Critics say new rental regulations do little to help renters

description.#cdata-section: Ontario has proposed new rental regulations in an effort to protect renters from so-called ‘renovictions’. But critics say the changes will mostly help landlords and do little to help renters.

item.title: 2 Philadelphia schools close, due to asbestos, school district officials say

description.#cdata-section: Mitchell Elementary, in Southwest Philly, and Frankford High School, in Frankford, are closing, due to asbestos found.

item.title: Canadian schools grappling with use of ChatGPT

description.#cdata-section: As artificial intelligence like ChatGPT begins to arrive in Canadian schools, teachers consider its impact on education. Some argue it should be banned, while others suggest making it a part of learning while focusing on critical thinking and creativity.
